DEEAE9AAFF5647CD80D7C2B5B1A22C80.description: Show evidence of becoming a life- long learner by using the target language and cultural knowledge for personal enrichment.

699E405021804F6981B17AF8ECABD181.description: Recognize and show the influences of the target language and/or cultures on the learner’s own community.

39A8209DF53644BEA2607548792E0339.description: Share experiences from the world language classroom within the  school and/or community.

F49D9C1628554A0F94C05191CBC7C178.description: Communities: Become an active global citizen by experiencing languages and cultures in multiple settings

EAE4D4BD123B4C509171F2D6CF95B9AF.description: Identify and describe contributions from the target cultures.

4186010365C647129758F5EE2705B048.description: Recognize and discuss celebrations and holidays of other cultures and compare them to those of the learner’s culture.

6ABDCF39A74B4CEC9A16395E7DE1FDAC.description: Compare the social patterns of other cultures and the learner’s own culture. 2.7.6 Recognize and discuss celebrations and holidays of other cultures and compare them to those of the learner’s culture. 2.7.7 Identify and describe contributions from the target cultures.

D8762D81C9254544B09E7EBF9B34B0BC.description: Compare and use authentic forms of address in a variety of social situations, both formal and informal.

A1DA03628517436BB9AC3BD3C7B689EB.description: Understand and use common idiomatic and colloquial expressions in the target language.

4B42902308DA4B7887B3FB0AC48E0C6E.description: Recognize and use level appropriate language structures.

68F01E6817114742BE3497BC7AD81F67.description: Recognize and use cognates and word  families shared between English and  the target language to expand  vocabulary and guess meaning.

906879B60C624FCFA74EFD9099C99D0F.description: Comparisons: Investigate the nature of language and culture

BAFF3C8FB9A94A409249222E131F29FF.description: Use digital media and culturally  authentic resources to study target language and cultures.

7E598A3B6B0A497D80BBE9F4A5572F73.description: Use digital media and culturally  authentic resources to reinforce and expand  vocabulary, improve reading ability, and  encourage cultural awareness.

62D4430AAB194B618D5664189056E175.description: Connections: Access and connect information through various media

937255CC0EBD4E5DB745936904508D2A.description: Implement content area concepts and skills through relevant activities. Examples: Learn a dance or sport from another culture (Wellness), play or sing a musical piece from the target culture (Fine Arts), etc.

50A0EA71403E41F9BC80BADEF249BC0E.description: Describe objects and concepts from other content areas. Examples: body parts and exercise (Wellness),  money conversion (Math standards)

8288DEF04AF04746B9BA463DB38AB73D.description: Connections: Make connections to other content areas

6BC9B1F121A14954B87555525DC9FA04.description: Perspectives- Describe influences on practices and products, such as technology, current events, and scientific discoveries, etc.

E2BFB20954BE4DB293E88F496E19A707.description: Products- Describe, in simple terms, products of the target cultures, such as media, films, literature, art, etc.

0200BC9BE7B24D76A215FB97C51F9258.description: Practices- Use situation-appropriate verbal and non-verbal communication.

29F1D1FDE4AC430CB038536FC4B21DBA.description: Practices- Describe frequently encountered social practices

B68A6A5673744E9585B31173385B03E7.description: Cultures: Develop awareness of other cultures

55E4BA88335543D9990520FAB2BDFA7E.description: Strategies  for Presenting Oral and         Written Language- Use grammar and syntax with increasing accuracy.

82B8B88D93694FBF843C54610D542509.description: Strategies  for Presenting Oral and         Written Language- Use intonation and pronunciation comprehensible to instructor and classmates with increasing accuracy

E938B55537E5446195DC33D54E40CCB8.description: Presenting  Written Language- Write short paragraphs to describe objects, self, and others in greater detail.

5DC76E18A1F44D3EB84AA7D0A5DCD735.description: Presenting Oral Language- Speak in complete sentences to describe objects, self, and others in greater detail.

D92C2602D58A44829F2FBE4FF9E2FD40.description: Presenting Oral Language- Present rehearsed material on familiar topics.

507955BDAFEA4D2989D9D95E187788AF.description: Communication: Present information in a language other than English

502E77CE0999414BB5C8DA8ABC72A904.description: Strategies for Comprehending Oral and Written Languages- Use strategies such as identifying context and purpose or scanning for specific information to extract meaning.

66C5B6E2534A4D96AC4FBDFA6C021C55.description: Strategies for Comprehending Oral and Written Languages- Use cognates, familiar vocabulary, or word families to extract meaning.

BD5239F6B5C34EFEBE1F050B813EAEA7.description: Comprehending Written Language- Demonstrate comprehension of short passages in the target language by identifying main ideas and some details from brief informational or simple fictional texts.

34F769E5356C4E1982C4CB4FC20A3146.description: Comprehending Oral Language- Demonstrate comprehension of short passages in the target language, spoken by native and non-native speakers.

3BB688F166E546F3972462781318DCD9.description: Comprehending Oral Language- Understand and respond to familiar requests, commands, and directions.

8E05EDBD347C4264A17773B17D59FB9F.description: Communication: Interpret information in a language other than English

CEDF080F756D4B59BF5B86A2702A5EBF.description: Strategies for Maintaining Oral / Written Exchanges- Use speaking and listening strategies that facilitate communication. Examples: Identifying key words, using synonyms and antonyms

7C37E35A837947298C47B06B3BC1664F.description: Written Request for Information- Make requests and ask questions for information.

FA783EF152BB424BA03C69C317DFEB62.description: Written Expression- Exchange routine information and opinions. Example: Write an e-mail to a pen pal, dialogue journals, social media, etc.

B0BD43A9502241ADA6C23CB9B5BC6DE1.description: Oral Request for Information- Make requests and ask questions for information.

ED406F2648BE44748A8C2C3E3F78AE8F.description: Oral Expression - Exchange basic information and opinions about self and others.

467FBFE7AB2048E18FD5879998C548AC.description: Oral Expression- Use multiple greetings and farewells in routine social situations, both formal and informal.

C6E11C90FDEB47F38F3D9BD5586F2B1F.description: Communication: Write and speak in a language other than English
